intro: Dicymbe heteroxylon, commonly known as the slender-stemmed burr legume, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring a slender stem and compound leaves with alternating pairs of leaflets. The plant produces small, clustered pods that contain kidney-shaped seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. Dicymbe heteroxylon is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential medicinal applications.
